Photo by Unsplash

This Week in Genesis there’s so much going on I had to publish a little later than usual to fit it all in, but I can promise you the wait is worth it because there’s big Genesis news, gorgeous new themes, and enough tutorials to keep you occupied till next week’s edition.

—

Genesis 2.3 beta and translations update

Before we dive into themes this week, two bits of news.

First up, the Genesis 2.3 beta has now been released with a whole load of tweaks (check out the changelog on the previous following link).

If you’re a developer, grab the Genesis Beta Tester plugin now and have a play!

#GenesisWP 2.3 Beta Now Available.https://t.co/bXjERm8TdY

And hey, look! A changelog!

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) June 8, 2016

Next up, a big update on the future of Genesis Translations (ably managed by Remkus de Vries). I won’t repeat everything he says in his post but it sounds like a big improvement.

Huge thanks to Remkus for everything he’s done and keeps doing with Genesis Translations to all our benefit (and if you’re able to contribute on any of the translations, get involved!).

We just published an important update about the future of the Genesis Translations plugin here https://t.co/vkNwFUqANa #genesiswp

— ThemeMix (@ThemeMix) June 9, 2016

Themes

And, if that wasn’t enough, Remkus also found time to release his first Genesis theme this week, Coach Pro.

Quite proud we finally released our first #genesiswp theme 🙂 https://t.co/XlSgcYc1cs

— Remkus de Vries (@DeFries) June 8, 2016

Next up, a stunning new photograpy theme, Elegance, from Stephanie Hellwig.

Just launched a #genesiswp #wordpress theme for photographers! Come check it out https://t.co/LUg0LiKsbh pic.twitter.com/ASVUt3W5DU

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) June 10, 2016

Sridhar’s been working on a free child theme inspired by firebase.google.com

Like the design of https://t.co/gi5yEycCZV so much that I am doing it as a free Genesis child theme.

Progress: https://t.co/0Ib3BzDEWr

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 8, 2016

Chinmoy at GenesisDeveloper.me releases a fifth skin (‘lawyer’) for his popular Starter Pro theme.

Released 5th skin of Starter Pro #genesiswp child theme. https://t.co/FWqZYG6XEX #wordpress #themes

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) June 9, 2016

A little update from Frank at WPStudio on his latest theme.

Working on the last details of the Seasons e-commerce theme.

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) June 7, 2016

Showcase

First up this week, a gorgeous site from Picrow Pixel for jamesbaylisssmith.com

New site launched for documentary cameraman & filmmaker @JBaylissSmith https://t.co/fZaePxJOTd #genesiswp

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) June 9, 2016

Next up, a great site from Bourn Creative for blog.sucuri.net

Proud to have worked with the team @sucurisecurity to redesign their blog. https://t.co/lhKO0KN4Y3 Built on #genesiswp

— Brian Bourn (@brianbourn) June 7, 2016

Love this site from Carrie Loves for thelittlemonsterblog.com

Website design for @fyfeworks https://t.co/b4QU4rLfaL #genesiswp Kindred theme from @stnsvn https://t.co/DOheohPqoW pic.twitter.com/OAlO2cDJYy

— carrie loves (@carrieloves) June 7, 2016

Really nice site from Jill Caren for alliancerally.org

Another #genesiswp complete. The custom built schedule makes us most proud! #webdesign #wordpress https://t.co/3I3n3OaKnp #GENESIS

— Jill Caren (@2dogsmedia) June 3, 2016

Justin McGuire for hutchinsonarts.org

Happy to support our local arts community with a great new website! https://t.co/lmh7uCqW0v #VividImage #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/2Ptb7DBWfO

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) June 9, 2016

…and another site for twotownsonedestination.com

Huzzah! Another great launch from the team at #VividImage! #GenesisWP https://t.co/jdhnacAqkm pic.twitter.com/cAp6Zj5wNo

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) June 3, 2016

Kevin Donnigan for ourtrueheroes.org

Our True Heroes – Website development by Anything Graphic – https://t.co/40VlovQcIT via @anythinggraphic #wordpress #genesiswp

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) June 9, 2016

Shaan Nicol for sassymediagroup.com

I almost forgot about this… I launched this at the pub on Friday night – https://t.co/hOcJp2hNEh #genesiswp

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) June 6, 2016

Tutorials

Anita Carter with a tutorial on how to add your author box to your about page in Genesis.

How to Add Your Author Box to Your About Page in Genesis https://t.co/yWyxEK3hRm #wordpress #genesiswp #bloggers #bbloggers #fbloggers

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) June 7, 2016

Nick Duell with a blog post on how to add all Google Fonts as an option in the customiser for the Site Header, Headings and body fonts in your theme, using the Kirki plugin and few code snippets.

Add Google Fonts with Kirki to any Genesis Theme

Josh Mallard on creating custom dynamic content without a page builder in Genesis.

New blog post, "Custom Dynamic Content without a Page Builder" https://t.co/nNogmVdTvh #wordpress #genesiswp

— Josh Mallard (@aBearded_Ginger) June 9, 2016

Neil Gee on removing the default Genesis responsive mobile menu.

Removing The Default Genesis Responsive Mobile Menu https://t.co/gntMiqsAuo #genesiswp

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) June 6, 2016

Frank Schrijvers on modifying read more text with accessibility support.

Modify the read more text with accessibility support https://t.co/h5uWNUWZNs #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) June 8, 2016

Sridhar’s been busy as ever:

  • How to display Author Box on all pages of author archives in Genesis
  • How to add a full width element inside Genesis header
  • Subtitles below Titles in Genesis using Visual Subtitle plugin

How to display Author Box on all pages of author archives in Genesis:https://t.co/7SAUnLUts0#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/8ejscdPwWr

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 5, 2016

How to add a full width element inside Genesis header: https://t.co/VAlKIEak3J#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/Q0K5oDB3iq

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 4, 2016

Best of the rest

Chris Lema updates his post on using Genesis without a child theme. Check out the interesting exchange with Gary Jones and the comments from Bill Erickson too.

UPDATED POST: https://t.co/Cq3aLuptoU

— Chris Lema (@chrislema) June 7, 2016

Ron with some updates on his Genesass theme.

Added some new functions and mixins to #GeneSass https://t.co/65SeXzycMH #GenesisWP

— RON (@RonWillemse) June 4, 2016

Bradley Potter’s been playing around with the Genesis Sample theme mobile menu.

The #GenesisWP Sample Theme with Header/Primary/Secondary menus restored & js mod to combine all into mobile menu https://t.co/swVaKyZqnq

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) June 9, 2016

https://t.co/IpMAmUPllb – see _combineMenus function mods

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) June 9, 2016

Here is the modified functions.php file – Note lines 79,80 & 82,83,84 commented out and line 94 depth changed https://t.co/PDXdgmkDtF

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) June 9, 2016

Responsive menu mods https://t.co/9h52Skz5o9

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) June 9, 2016

And finally…

It’s not always Genesis specific, but the Genesis community’s own Bill Erickson has been putting out some great content on his blog recently, so I definitely encourage you to have a browse of that, plus his latest post rounding up his (many) excellent plugins.

Recent Plugin Updates, including Display Posts Shortcode, wp cli install-missing and Media from Production https://t.co/g2hVcPomrY

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) June 9, 2016

—

That’s all for this week, keep on keeping on, and have a great weekend.

PS A big thank you to everyone who helped me with a few things on the Genesis Slack community this week, if you’re not already a member, go join now and get involved.

PPS I’ve got a couple of exciting guest editors coming very soon, stay tuned 🙂

PPPS Did you subscribe? 😉
